title: Financial Statements & Corporate Governance
description: Deep dive into accounting statements, auditing principles, and the passive voice in financial reporting (50 items).

items.prompt: Which financial statement provides a 'snapshot' of a company's financial position at a specific point in time?
items.explanation: The Balance Sheet reports assets, liabilities, and equity at a specific date.

items.prompt: What is the accounting equation used in a Balance Sheet?
items.explanation: Assets = Liabilities + Shareholders' Equity is the fundamental accounting equation.

items.prompt: What is the 'bottom line' of an Income Statement?
items.explanation: Net Income is the final profit or loss after all expenses have been deducted.

items.prompt: In the Cash Flow Statement, buying a new piece of machinery is classified under:
items.explanation: Investing activities include the purchase and sale of long-term assets like equipment.

items.prompt: What does an 'Unqualified Opinion' from an auditor mean?
options: The auditor is not qualified to check the accounts
The financial statements are presented fairly and accurately ('clean')
The auditor found major errors and rejected the statements
The auditor needs more time to finish the report
items.explanation: An unqualified opinion is the best result a company can receive from an audit.

items.prompt: Which body is responsible for overseeing the management of a corporation on behalf of shareholders?
items.explanation: The Board of Directors has a fiduciary duty to shareholders.

options: The duty to maximize marketing reach
The legal and ethical obligation to act in the best interest of another party
items.explanation: Directors and officers have a fiduciary duty to the corporation and its shareholders.

items.prompt: Choose the correct passive voice construction: 'The report ___ by the committee yesterday.'
items.explanation: Past passive (was + past participle) for an action completed in the past.

options: The deal was signed by the CEO.
We are signing the deal tomorrow.
They have signed the deal already.
items.explanation: 'The deal was signed' uses the passive structure (be + past participle).

items.prompt: Which audit opinion is issued when the financial statements are significantly misrepresented?
items.explanation: An adverse opinion means the records do not follow GAAP/IFRS and are misleading.

options: A manager who controls all employees
Processes to ensure reliable financial reporting and legal compliance
items.explanation: Internal controls help prevent fraud and errors.

items.prompt: Complete with the passive voice: 'It ___ that inflation will rise next quarter.'
items.explanation: Impersonal passive structure 'It is expected that...' is common in financial reporting.

items.prompt: What does 'PPE' stand for on a balance sheet?
items.explanation: PPE represents the long-term tangible assets of a business.

items.prompt: Which statement tracks the liquidity of a company?
items.explanation: The Cash Flow statement shows how much actual cash is available.

options: A lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts (an error)

items.explanation: Auditors look for discrepancies between the books and physical evidence.

options: Only the people who own shares
Anyone who has an interest or is affected by a company's actions
The people who work in the warehouse
items.explanation: Stakeholders include employees, customers, suppliers, and the community, not just shareholders.

items.prompt: Complete the passive sentence: 'The annual audit ___ (carry out) by PwC.'
items.explanation: Present continuous passive (is being + past participle) for an ongoing action.

options: Blowing a whistle at a sports event
Reporting illegal or unethical activity within an organization
A marketing technique to attract attention
items.explanation: Whistleblowing is a key aspect of ethical corporate governance.
Working capital measures a company's short-term financial health.

items.prompt: What is the purpose of an 'External Audit'?
options: To help the company sell more products
To provide an independent opinion on the fairness of financial statements
items.explanation: External audits provide assurance to shareholders and regulators.
GAAP is the standard framework of guidelines for financial accounting in the US.

items.prompt:
AUDIT REPORT SUMMARY: 'We have audited the accompanying balance sheet of XYZ Corp as of December 31. In our opinion, the financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the company. However, we draw attention to Note 4 regarding a pending lawsuit which may impact future liquidity.' 

What type of opinion did the auditor likely give?
items.explanation: The phrase 'present fairly, in all material respects' indicates an unqualified (clean) opinion, even if they added an 'emphasis of matter' regarding the lawsuit.

items.prompt:
CORPORATE GOVERNANCE MEMO: 'The Board has decided to implement a new Code of Ethics to strengthen our fiduciary duty. All executives are now required to disclose any potential conflicts of interest immediately to the compliance officer.' 

What is the main goal of the new policy?
options: To prevent conflicts of interest and improve ethics
To reduce the number of meetings
To change the company's brand image
items.explanation: The text focuses on ethics, fiduciary duty, and disclosing conflicts of interest.

items.prompt:

items.explanation: Higher revenue didn't lead to higher profit because expenses increased even more.
